title: Another Journey
opening: A month has passed since word came of Marquess Pherae's disappearance. Rumors and speculation run rampant throughout Lycia. The head of House Ostia, Lord Uther, takes no apparent interest. The marquess's younger brother is considered odd by the populace. He and Marquess Pherae's son, Eliwood, are fast friends. A hot-blooded youth, he cannot ignore his friend's plight. Marquess Ostia's younger brother, Hector. He would one day be a courageous general, a steel warrior to be feared. The path he chooses will test him to the limits of his strength.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Brother! Brother!! Where is he!? He's here, isn't he?

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Lord Hector! Calm yourself!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: No words, Oswin! Just move!

intro.speaker: Uther
intro.line: That's enough, Hector! What is the meaning of this?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You know full well! The disappearance of Marquess Pherae!

intro.speaker: Uther
intro.line: We've discussed this time and time again. This matter is none of Ostia's affair. We have no reason to involve ourselves. It would be folly to do so.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood's father is missing, for goodness' sake! We know that Marquess Laus is connected in some way. I say we use Ostia's might to end this mystery and find the truth!

intro.speaker: Uther
intro.line: Calm yourself, you fool! An invasion would be madness! Lycia can ill afford the chaos such an action would bring. Surely even you must understand that!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Bah... I understand all too well, Brother! Stay there on your throne. Sit there until it rots beneath you! I will do this alone!!

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Lord Hector! You should watch your tone...

intro.speaker: Uther
intro.line: Peace, Oswin. Let him go. There's no reasoning with him when he gets like this.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Matthew! Matthew! Blast it! Where could he be?

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: I'm right here.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You... You're not a wraith. Stop skulking in the shadows like one.

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Hm? A wraith? And here I thought I was a spy. Be that as it may. As milord ordered, here are your travel rations and your beloved axe. And I've purchased the silence of some royal guardsmen. You're free to slip out the rear entrance and vanish.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Well done, Matthew. Try not to let my brother discover my absence too quickly.

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: What? I thought I was going with you.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You're a bigger fool than I'd imagined! Did you think I would trust my brother's spy? Who knows when you would turn me in for some favor! Where I go, I go alone!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Shh! You keep on shouting, and you'll go nowhere! Every guard in the palace must have heard that!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Enough... Do not try and follow me!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: I did not imagine you would find me so untrustworthy. Professional hazard, it seems. Watch yourself, young master.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Huh? He... He gave up too easily. I don't trust him... The time has come... I've got to get out of here and rendezvous with Eliwood. These bags! What did Matthew put in these things?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: This is ridiculous even if he was packing for two! Huh? .......Come out. I know you're there.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Who are you?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Too dumb to speak? Makes no difference to me. Move out of my way, or I'll run you through!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Hah!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Whoa! M-Milord! Stay your arm! It's me!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Who? Matthew? I was sure you were one of them.

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Well, I'm not! I'm one of me. And I would prefer to remain in one piece.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Your fault for jumping out of nowhere. Now tell me, what are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Hm? I... I sensed that something was wrong and...came to your aid.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: My aid... I'll accept that answer for the time being.

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: So, what should we do?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: About what?

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: About the fellows between us and the way out. I'd say there are 7 or 8 of them. To make matters worse, they seem highly competent. I know you're confident in your martial abilities, but... I'm not the strongest sword arm around, and, well...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: If you've something to say, Matthew, then say it!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: We could abandon the rear entrance. I'm sure the royal guardsmen would be happy to aid us, and...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Never!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: That's what I thought you would say. All that's left is to avoid getting killed, right?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You can go back if you want.

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: In your own words, milord, never. I'm with you, wherever that may lead.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Right. Then let's give them a good thrashing and get out of here!

boss.speaker: Hector
boss.line: You're not Marquess Laus's assassins, are you? You're too good, too professional. Nothing like those idiots over there.

boss.speaker: Wire
boss.line: You've no need to know, little Lord Hector. A fool like you, sneaking out of the country alone... You'll go missing, never to return. Your body will never be found. Tidy story, eh? Ha ha...

boss.speaker: Hector
boss.line: Tsk tsk... Looks like your luck's run out.

boss.speaker: Hector
boss.line: You see, I'm about as angry as I've ever been. I doubt that even a dozen of you could slow me down. Prepare to die!!!

boss.speaker: Wire
boss.line: The Ostian spy. Why did you return?

boss.speaker: Matthew
boss.line: I've known you were here for some time. I also knew you were after Lord Hector, not me. You're all professional assassins. You wait for your chance, and you don't miss it. You were waiting for me to leave Lord Hector alone. That's when you were planning to attack, right?

boss.speaker: Wire
boss.line: Ah... So that's why you came back, is it? I was sure you'd gone back to play with the guards.

boss.speaker: Matthew
boss.line: If I had, I would've taken Lord Hector with me. No matter what it took.

boss.speaker: Wire
boss.line: Cheeky fellow, aren't you? But you're out of your league.

boss.speaker: Wire
boss.line: You think to challenge me? Prepare to die, you witless fool!

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Whew... That was close. Glad we're both all right. Come, milord, we must fly! The castle guard must have heard all the noise.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Matthew, you rogue. You knew this was all going to happen, didn't you?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: What else could I do? Those assassins wouldn't show themselves until you were alone.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I suppose... Mark my words, Matthew! You're coming with me. But from this point forward, you are no longer my brother's spy. You are my man now, to the bitter end.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Yes, milord! Shall I swear a knightly vow?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: To what purpose? Your own words will hold you well enough.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: True enough!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Let us go then! To Eliwood!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: My lord! Marquess! It's Lord Hector! He's--

end.speaker: Uther
end.line: He's gone, isn't he?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Ye... Yes, milord! We are gathering men now to give chase.

end.speaker: Uther
end.line: Attend me. We will let him go.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Milord?

end.speaker: Uther
end.line: A... Headstrong fool... Oooh... Cough...cough...

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Uther! Are you well?

end.speaker: Uther
end.line: ... ...I'm fine. It has passed. There is no need for concern.

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: You must not rely so much on physical strength alone. It has been most trying these past few weeks. The affairs of the court have not let you sleep. You might endanger your health if you keep on...

end.speaker: Uther
end.line: Yes, Oswin. I understand. I will speak with a physician on the morrow. Will that allay your fears?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Yes, my lord. I shall make the arrangements.

end.speaker: Uther
end.line: Oswin... About Hector... I can entrust him to you, yes?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Of course, my lord. I will guard him with my very life's blood.
